title: Manage CAPA from Quality Audit
description: Following a regulatory inspection, a quality manager must create and track a Corrective and Preventive Action (CAPA) to address a finding.

tasks.description: Log the audit finding into the quality management system.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent creates a new record for the finding: 'Inadequate training records for lab staff'.

tasks.description: Create a new CAPA plan linked to the finding.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent drafts a CAPA plan with steps for corrective action (retrain staff) and preventive action (implement new training tracker).

tasks.description: Assign ownership and due dates for the CAPA tasks.
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent assigns the retraining task to the Lab Manager and the tracker implementation to the IT department.

tasks.description: Track the CAPA to completion and link evidence of closure (e.g., training certificates).
tasks.expected_outcome: Agent monitors task completion, attaches the required evidence, and formally closes the CAPA.
